dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Use SPAGeDi to compute a variety of F_st, or F-statistics, on input data.

SPAGeDi was created by Olivier Hardy and Xavier Vekemans. More information can be found on the SPAGeDi website (http://ebe.ulb.ac.be/ebe/SPAGeDi.html).
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Created by the geneGIS team: Dori Dick, Shaun Walbridge, Scott Baker, Dawn Wright

tool.name: SpagediFst

param.name: Population Field
param.dialogReference: Input dataset field which contains the populations used for comparison.

param.name: Analysis_Type
param.dialogReference: Jacknifing: mean jackknifed estimators and jackknife standard errors (SE) are computed for multilocus average statistics. They can be used to derive approximate confidence intervals using the mean ± 2SE. Jackknifying necessitates at least 2 polymorphic loci, but many polymorphic loci estimates are necessary to obtain reliable SE. Because SE are approximate, they should not be used for formal tests. (From SPAGeDI manual, §4.2.5)

param.name: Output_File
param.dialogReference: A text file containing the results of the SPAGeDi analysis. Will be opened in the default text editor once analysis is complete.

tool.summary:
Use SPAGeDi to compute a variety of F_st, or F-statistics, on input data.

SPAGeDi was created by Olivier Hardy and Xavier Vekemans. More information can be found on the SPAGeDi website (http://ebe.ulb.ac.be/ebe/SPAGeDi.html).
